p: The antimicrobial activity in both methanol and ether extract of Ageratum conyzoides L. has been reported. This herb contains antimicrobial components which are useful against oxidase enzyme in bacteria which is a pathogen and related to the systemic infection, leading to deadly effect in animal and human [ 22]. Another study also explores that essential oil in Ageratum conyzoides L. had a potential antimicrobial towards Escherichia coli and Klebsiella pneumoniae (uropathogenic bacteria) and, therefore, is useful in the prophylactic of urinary tract infection [ 60].
